Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 07:08AM Nannyof2 wrote: Hi Loving_mother - I had a sentinel node biopsy done - I guess it is the new wave - saves unnecessary removal of nodes - My biopsy showed the nodes had been affected so during surgery (a lumpectomy) I had 9 nodes removed - only one was cancerous!! Lucky me I think - I had the lumpectomy and recovered amazinly from the surgery - later the end of the first week I had an infection from hell (if you see any signs of infection get on straight away - it is horrible) so be careful and keep an watchful eyes for any signs - my breasts (I am small) are changed (my right breast (cancer and surgery) is indented and noticeable - but the tumor is out and I can live with the difference - I have traded bras for tank tops tight fitting and shelf bras inside - they are most comfortable - I have not yet started chemo or radiation my surgery was Dec 3 - but have my first appt on jan 7th - good luck - things will go well from your surgery - I felt great the next day. Happy new year
